meanings.definition: The female reproductive structure of a flower, containing the ovary, style, and stigma.
meanings.sent1: The archicarps of the flower hold the seeds for new plants.
meanings.sent2: Bees help in pollination by transferring pollen to the archicarps of flowers.
meanings.sent3: The archicarps of the daisy were so colorful, they looked like tiny jewels.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like the archicarps of a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent5: The archicarps, like tiny treasure chests, held the promise of new life.

meanings.definition: A structure in certain algae that produces spores.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the archicarps of the algae were visible.
meanings.sent2: The archicarps of the seaweed released spores into the water.
meanings.sent3: The archicarps of the algae danced in the water, spreading spores around.
meanings.sent4: The archicarps of the seaweed were like tiny factories producing spores.
meanings.sent5: The archicarps of the algae burst open, scattering spores in all directions.

meanings.definition: The main axis of a compound inflorescence.
meanings.sent1: The archicarps of the inflorescence supported the growth of the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully trimmed the archicarps to maintain the plant's balance.
meanings.sent3: The archicarps of the flower arrangement stood tall and proud.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership was like the archicarps, guiding the team towards success.
meanings.sent5: The archicarps of the inflorescence intertwined gracefully, forming a beautiful display.
